verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the bloody<WH1818> city!<WH5892> it is all<WH3605> full<WH4392> of lies<WH3585> and robbery;<WH6563> the prey<WH2964> departeth<WH4185> not;<WH3808>
The noise<WH6963> of a whip,<WH7752> and the noise<WH6963> of the rattling<WH7494> of the wheels,<WH212> and of the prancing<WH1725> horses,<WH5483> and of the jumping<WH7540> chariots.<WH4818>

The horseman<WH6571> lifteth up<WH5927> both the bright<WH3851> sword<WH2719> and the glittering<WH1300> spear:<WH2595> and there is a multitude<WH7230> of slain,<WH2491> and a great number<WH3514> of carcasses;<WH6297> and there is none<WH369> end<WH7097> of their corpses;<WH1472> they stumble<WH3782> upon their corpses: <WH1472>

Because of the multitude<WH4480> <WH7230> of the whoredoms<WH2183> of the well favored<WH2896> <WH2580> harlot,<WH2181> the mistress<WH1172> of witchcrafts,<WH3785> that selleth<WH4376> nations<WH1471> through her whoredoms,<WH2183> and families<WH4940> through her witchcrafts.<WH3785>

Behold, <WH2009> I am against<WH413> thee, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts;<WH6635> and I will discover<WH1540> thy skirts<WH7757> upon<WH5921> thy face,<WH6440> and I will show<WH7200> the nations<WH1471> thy nakedness,<WH4626> and the kingdoms<WH4467> thy shame.<WH7036>
And I will cast<WH7993> abominable filth<WH8251> upon<WH5921> thee, and make thee vile,<WH5034> and will set<WH7760> thee as a gazingstock.<WH7210>

And it shall come to pass,<WH1961> that all<WH3605> they that look upon<WH7200> thee shall flee<WH5074> from<WH4480> thee, and say,<WH559> Nineveh<WH5210> is laid waste:<WH7703> who<WH4310> will bemoan<WH5110> her? whence<WH4480> <WH370> shall I seek<WH1245> comforters<WH5162> for thee?

Art thou better<WH3190> than populous<WH528> No,<WH4480> <WH4996> that was situate<WH3427> among the rivers,<WH2975> that had the waters<WH4325> round about<WH5439> it, whose<WH834> rampart<WH2426> was the sea,<WH3220> and her wall<WH2346> was from the sea?<WH4480> <WH3220>
Ethiopia <WH3568> and Egypt<WH4714> were her strength,<WH6109> and it was infinite;<WH369> <WH7097> Put<WH6316> and Lubim<WH3864> were<WH1961> thy helpers.<WH5833>

Yet <WH1571> was she<WH1931> carried away,<WH1473> she went<WH1980> into captivity:<WH7628> her young children<WH5768> also<WH1571> were dashed in pieces<WH7376> at the top<WH7218> of all<WH3605> the streets:<WH2351> and they cast<WH3032> lots<WH1486> for<WH5921> her honorable men,<WH3513> and all<WH3605> her great men<WH1419> were bound<WH7576> in chains.<WH2131>
Thou <WH859> also<WH1571> shalt be drunken:<WH7937> thou shalt be<WH1961> hid,<WH5956> thou<WH859> also<WH1571> shalt seek<WH1245> strength<WH4581> because of the enemy.<WH4480> <WH341>

All <WH3605> thy strongholds<WH4013> shall be like fig trees<WH8384> with<WH5973> the firstripe figs:<WH1061> if<WH518> they be shaken,<WH5128> they shall even fall<WH5307> into<WH5921> the mouth<WH6310> of the eater.<WH398>

Behold, <WH2009> thy people<WH5971> in the midst<WH7130> of thee are women:<WH802> the gates<WH8179> of thy land<WH776> shall be set wide open<WH6605> <WH6605> unto thine enemies:<WH341> the fire<WH784> shall devour<WH398> thy bars.<WH1280>

Draw <WH7579> thee waters<WH4325> for the siege,<WH4692> fortify<WH2388> thy strongholds:<WH4013> go<WH935> into clay,<WH2916> and tread<WH7429> the mortar,<WH2563> make strong<WH2388> the brickkiln.<WH4404>

There <WH8033> shall the fire<WH784> devour<WH398> thee; the sword<WH2719> shall cut thee off,<WH3772> it shall eat thee up<WH398> like the cankerworm:<WH3218> make thyself many<WH3513> as the cankerworm,<WH3218> make thyself many<WH3513> as the locusts.<WH697>
Thou hast multiplied<WH7235> thy merchants<WH7402> above the stars<WH4480> <WH3556> of heaven:<WH8064> the cankerworm<WH3218> spoileth,<WH6584> and flieth away.<WH5774>

Thy crowned<WH4502> are as the locusts,<WH697> and thy captains<WH2951> as the great grasshoppers,<WH1462> <WH1462> which camp<WH2583> in the hedges<WH1448> in the cold<WH7135> day,<WH3117> but when the sun<WH8121> ariseth<WH2224> they flee away,<WH5074> and their place<WH4725> is not known<WH3045> <WH3808> where<WH335> they are.

Thy shepherds<WH7462> slumber,<WH5123> O king<WH4428> of Assyria:<WH804> thy nobles<WH117> shall dwell<WH7931> in the dust: thy people<WH5971> is scattered<WH6335> upon<WH5921> the mountains,<WH2022> and no man<WH369> gathereth<WH6908> them.

There is no<WH369> healing<WH3545> of thy bruise;<WH7667> thy wound<WH4347> is grievous:<WH2470> all<WH3605> that hear<WH8085> the bruit<WH8088> of thee shall clap<WH8628> the hands<WH3709> over<WH5921> thee: for<WH3588> upon<WH5921> whom<WH4310> hath not<WH3808> thy wickedness<WH7451> passed<WH5674> continually?<WH8548>
